publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1282 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Alternative Festival—That the Parliament regrets the demise of the Aberdeen Alternative Festival and calls upon Aberdeen City Council, other agencies and the private sector to do everything possible to resurrect the festival in the near future and to put major emphasis on ensuring the survival of the community programme, which has done a great deal to bring the arts to the people and has encouraged many to participate in events.
S1M-1282 Aberdeen Alternative Festival (lodged on 25 October 2000) Shona Robison*

S1M-1282 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Alternative Festival—That the Parliament regrets the demise of the Aberdeen Alternative Festival and calls upon Aberdeen City Council, other agencies and the private sector to do everything possible to resurrect the festival in the near future and to put major emphasis on ensuring the survival of the community programme, which has done a great deal to bring the arts to the people and has encouraged many to participate in events. Supported by: Shona Robison
S1M-1282 Aberdeen Alternative Festival (lodged on 25 October 2000) Irene McGugan*, Michael Russell*
S1M-1282 Aberdeen Alternative Festival (lodged on 25 October 2000) Tommy Sheridan*, Fiona McLeod*
S1M-1282 Aberdeen Alternative Festival (lodged on 25 October 2000) Nora Radcliffe*

S1M-1282 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Alternative Festival—That the Parliament regrets the demise of the Aberdeen Alternative Festival and calls upon Aberdeen City Council, other agencies and the private sector to do everything possible to resurrect the festival in the near future and to put major emphasis on ensuring the survival of the community programme, which has done a great deal to bring the arts to the people and has encouraged many to participate in events. Supported by: Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Michael Russell, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Nora Radcliffe
S1M-1282 Aberdeen Alternative Festival (lodged on 25 October 2000) Mr Lloyd Quinan*, Mr Gil Paterson*, Mr Adam Ingram*
S1M-1282 Aberdeen Alternative Festival (lodged on 25 October 2000) Ms Sandra White*

S1M-1282 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Alternative Festival-That the Parliament regrets the demise of the Aberdeen Alternative Festival and calls upon Aberdeen City Council, other agencies and the private sector to do everything possible to resurrect the festival in the near future and to put major emphasis on ensuring the survival of the community programme, which has done a great deal to bring the arts to the people and has encouraged many to participate in events. Supported by: Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Michael Russell, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Sandra White
S1M-1282 Aberdeen Alternative Festival (lodged on 25 October 2000) Andrew Wilson*

S1M-1282 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Alternative Festival-That the Parliament regrets the demise of the Aberdeen Alternative Festival and calls upon Aberdeen City Council, other agencies and the private sector to do everything possible to resurrect the festival in the near future and to put major emphasis on ensuring the survival of the community programme, which has done a great deal to bring the arts to the people and has encouraged many to participate in events. Supported by: Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Michael Russell, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Sandra White, Andrew Wilson

S1M-1282 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Alternative Festival—That the Parliament regrets the demise of the Aberdeen Alternative Festival and calls upon Aberdeen City Council, other agencies and the private sector to do everything possible to resurrect the festival in the near future and to put major emphasis on ensuring the survival of the community programme, which has done a great deal to bring the arts to the people and has encouraged many to participate in events. Supported by: Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Michael Russell, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Sandra White, Andrew Wilson, Richard Lochhead*

S1M-1282 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Alternative Festival-That the Parliament regrets the demise of the Aberdeen Alternative Festival and calls upon Aberdeen City Council, other agencies and the private sector to do everything possible to resurrect the festival in the near future and to put major emphasis on ensuring the survival of the community programme, which has done a great deal to bring the arts to the people and has encouraged many to participate in events. Supported by: Shona Robison, Irene McGugan, Michael Russell, Tommy Sheridan, Fiona McLeod, Nora Radcliffe, Mr Lloyd Quinan, Mr Gil Paterson, Mr Adam Ingram, Ms Sandra White, Andrew Wilson, Richard Lochhead

S1M-1282 Brian Adam: Aberdeen Alternative Festival-That the Parliament regrets the demise of the Aberdeen Alternative Festival and calls upon Aberdeen City Council, other agencies and the private sector to do everything possible to resurrect the festival in the near future and to put major emphasis on ensuring the survival of the community programme, which has done a great deal to bring the arts to the people and has encouraged many to participate in events.
